channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As young male voters shift Right, can the Left compete in the 'battle for the bros'?
item.description: Popular podcasts in the "manosphere" helped sway young men to go MAGA in the 2024 election. New Yorker writer Andrew Marantz explains how Democrats ca...

item.title: Pentagon restores webpages of Black veterans, Navajo Code Talkers and others after outcry
item.description: A Pentagon official not authorized to speak publicly said its review to scrub websites of DEI content was too hasty and also used search terms like "g...

item.title: West Bank Palestinians displaced by Israel's military fear they'll never go home again
item.description: Even as the war in Gaza continues, Israel's prime minister says a "larger and more intense front could be opened" in the West Bank, where more than 40...

item.title: Israel expands its ground offensive in Gaza as Hamas fires rockets back
item.description: The Israeli military expanded its ground offensive in Gaza, and killed at least 80 Palestinians in a new wave of strikes Thursday. Hamas fired its fir...

item.title: Do you feel you can exercise your right to free speech? NPR wants to hear from you
item.description: NPR wants to know who is feeling more and less free to exercise their free speech rights in this moment. Have you found yourself letting loose more un...

item.title: At least 85 killed in new Israeli Gaza strikes, Hamas-run health ministry says
item.description: Hamas fires rockets at Israel in response, as Israel resumes ground and air operations in Gaza.

item.title: Carney to call snap election as Canada faces trade war with US - reports
item.description: The former two-time central banker is expected to pitch himself as the candidate best equipped for a trade battle with the US.

item.title: World's oldest Michelin-starred restaurant loses a star
item.description: Georges Blanc's restaurant first earned a Michelin star under his grandmother, back in 1929.

item.title: Mar 20: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: President Trump expected to begin the process of dismantling the Education Department; Boston photographer uses social media to track down couple capt...

item.title: GOP state Sen. Justin Eichorn resigns after federal charge
item.description: State Sen. Justin Eichorn submitted his letter of resignation on Thursday, GOP Leader Mark Johnson said in a statement, following a federal criminal c...

item.title: Thousands gather to mourn North Macedonia nightclub fire dead
item.description: Some 59 people died in the blaze at Pulse nightclub, which officials say had an illegal licence.

item.title: Taliban frees an American man who was abducted while traveling in Afghanistan more than 2 years ago
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is praising Qatar for helping the U.S. secure the release of an American held by the Taliban for more than two years.

item.title: 3/20: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: President Trump is expected to sign an executive order to begin the process of dismantling the Department of Education. Plus, fighting bird flu as the...

item.title: Oklahoma executes man who killed woman in 2005 home invasion
item.description: Wendell Grissom received a lethal injection at the Oklahoma State Penitentiary and was pronounced dead at 10:13 a.m.

item.title: Trump suggests US could run Ukraine's power plants
item.description: The US president says peace efforts are "very much on track", a day after Russia's president declined to agree a full ceasefire.

item.title: Boston Celtics sold for $6.1 billion
item.description: The Boston Celtics are being sold​ to William Chisholm for $6.1 billion.

item.title: Georgetown scholar detained over American wife’s Palestinian ties, lawyer says
Oklahoma executes the man who killed a woman 20 years ago in a home invasion and robbery
